attributes.action: Take evidence and expert advice into account alongside the EU referendum result.
attributes.background: For the reasons outlined below we the undersigned request that parliament take into consideration evidence, data and facts from a panel of academics and experts on the benefits and cons of being in the EU before making a final decision on whether or not leave.
attributes.additional_details: Reasons: The EU referendum result is advisory not legally binding; The electorate is so evenly divided; The age demographic bias towards under 50's wanting to remain a member; The impact leaving will have on future generations currently unable to vote; The inaccuracy of some claims made by campaigners; The influence of possible media bias during campaigning; Lack of expertise and insight on key issues amongst the general public.

attributes.action: We want a public database so we can see who we voted for in each election.
attributes.background: We want a transparent world and I believe being able to see who we voted for as well as our peers is a big step in this. We have the technology to do this with ease. It also makes sure that the whole system isn't corrupt.

attributes.action: Ring-fence current social service and care spending.
attributes.background: A failure to ring-fence government and local council spending on social care and services has allowed spending cuts to leave such services underfunded, and unable to meet the needs of the entire population - which can be seen in numerous failures of care for children, the elderly, and the disabled.
attributes.additional_details: Only last year adult social care regulators were reported to be receiving up to 150 reports of abuse per day - which Andrea Sutcliffe (Head of Adult Social Care) attributed to service failures, caused by underfunding. Moreover, children Trae-Bleu Layne, Rio Ross, Keanu Williams and Khyra Ishaq (four examples of many) - all died due to a lack of an organised response towards their welfare by social services - which may have been provided had funding been available to plan such a response.

attributes.action: Make it law that every childcare setting has cctv cameras on at all times
attributes.background: My sons nursery has been closed down due to staff being accused of child cruelty. However there is no physical evidence. All childcare settings by law should have cctv in operation for the protection of children and transparency

attributes.action: Urge the US to ban assault rifles being available outside of the military
attributes.background: After recent shootings in America, I believe we need to stop military grade weaponry being available to people outside of the military. Did you know people on the terrorist watch list in American can buy assault rifles! This needs to stop. Let's not lose any people anymore.

attributes.action: Allow for the easier issuing of compulsory purchase orders by local authorities.
attributes.background: There are many towns and cities in the United Kingdom with derelict properties that are allowed to waste away unchallenged. The legal and financial implications surrounding compulsory purchase orders, which in theory should allow local authorities to stop this issue, is often an unviable option.
attributes.additional_details: The issue of land banking (which involves the purchasing of site/land/property with the sole purpose of holding onto it until its value increases) often results in sites being left to waste away for many years. Giving local authorities greater powers would put an end to this practice and in theory, ensure sites are either redeveloped or at least brought back into use more quickly.

attributes.action: Ban teaching children under 16 religion
attributes.background: Leaders of religious and faith based groups raise money from supporters on an unproven pretext. In any sphere of life this amounts to fraud.
attributes.additional_details: No faith based teaching should be allowed to be given to children under the age of 16. The concept of a external superior force or being is so incredible that children need early indoctrination for the idea to take hold. It is unlikely that given free will an individual would arrive at the idea that our actions our guided by an unearthly force.

attributes.action: Make the parliamentary select committee process similar to a civil court hearing
attributes.background: Having recently seen the parliamentary select committee for Dominic Chappell regarding BHS, it seemed all too easy for him to make unsubstantiated statements in defence of his conduct, and hide behind documents not being readily available.
attributes.additional_details: For example,  when Chappell was asked how much profit he made from BHS he did not have the answer and said he would provide it 'as soon as practicable ', this would not have happened if there was a proper process in place.  This absolutely crucial information should have been required by the committee in advance.

attributes.action: Remove ethics questions from science exams at all levels of education.
attributes.background: For most people ethics are easy, but for psychopaths they are often an ungraspable concept. This does not make them evil, most psychopaths are just disadvantaged and live peacefully otherwise. However, I feel it is unfair to put a minority at such a disadvantage purely because of how they were born.
attributes.additional_details: Psychopaths are a relatively large minority in the UK, which means that a significant quantity of students are completely unable to answer questions regarding ethics through no fault fo their own. I feel that this is discrimination against certain people and should be changed to give them a fair chance at an exam just like anybody else. Exams are vital to success in later life and being put at a disadvantage just because the exam board doesn't consider everyone is very unfair in my opinion.

attributes.action: Make all use & movement of HGV during peak times; 7-9am & 3-6pm illegal.
attributes.background:
Our lives are busy. Getting the kids ready for school, working hard all day, paying our tax.
The last thing we need is to be stuck behind a lorry or in a huge queue because of a number of HGV's at the traffic lights ahead. 
Imagine how easier the commute would be without any HGV's on the road.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose we limit the amount of time the HGV drivers are allowed to drive on the road. 
I'm a HGV driver myself but I'm also in the military and must commute to work through Leicester every morning and for a reasonably small city, the traffic is ridiculous and its usually because an HGV is sat at the lights, takes 9-10 seconds to select a gear and pull away, in which time the lights are red again. 

Limiting the HGV to an off peak travel would free up our roads and limit congestion.

attributes.action: Award allied military veterans an honour 70 years after their conflict finishes.
attributes.background: France has been awarding the Chevalier in the Ordre de la Légion d’Honneur, equivalent to a British MBE, to veterans 70 years after a conflict finishes. As our veterans are now effectively ambassadors to the younger generations, British and allied veterans should be recognized in similar fashion.
attributes.additional_details:
Grand Chancery of the Legion of Honor 
http://www.legiondhonneur.fr/en

The application for the Legion D’Honneur for British Veterans
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/d-day-70-application-form-for-award-of-the-legion-dhonneur

British Legion press release: LEGION D'HONNEUR AWARD FOR D-DAY VETERANS
http://support.britishlegion.org.uk/app/answers/detail/a_id/1308/~/legion-dhonneur-award-for-d-day-veterans

attributes.action: Put more pressure on people and other countries to cut global warming
attributes.background: I understand that the government is already trying to cut down global warming but I still don't believe everything is being done. The purpose of a government is to better our future by learning from what has gone wrong. Flooding will increase with global warming, as will the cost of flood repairs..
attributes.additional_details: Sea levels are set to rise by twice as much as anticipated by the end of this century, showing that we are not prepared for the extent of the problems that this on going issue will create. The record for the lowest area of ice coverage in the Arctic is set to happen either this year or next year which creates yet another issue for our wildlife, which has been ignored because we rank the life of an endangered animal that doesn't contribute to pollution lower than our own.

attributes.action: Introduce basic income in the UK for every citizen whether they work or not.
attributes.background: I believe that if everyone receives a basic income, whether they are working or not, it will make citizens feel more equal.
attributes.additional_details: We really do need this proposal to go ahead because there are so many people that are homeless or not at work, and are struggling to live of minimal benefits. So if this basic income is introduced, I feel that less people will be homeless and can live their lives normally.

attributes.action: Make it legal that there is a 2 hour minimum break per day for  live in carers.
attributes.background: Make it legally binding that all live-in care work,  though agencys ensure a 2 hour minimum break per day for carers. There should also  be a waking night carer throughout the night if necessary. carers are exploited by care agencies and private employers as there are no fixed rules for breaks
attributes.additional_details: Most live-in carers are too afraid to speak up in case they lose their job or get bad references. It is very common for carers to work up to 16 hours a day, plus getting up during the night. Most carers get paid from £65 to £95 per day and are still expected to have a happy disposition and fulfill all their duties - often without breaks. Slavery was abolished in the UK nearly 200 years ago. Please stop live in care givers being exploited  give them the voice and rights they deserve.

attributes.action: Put a cap on how many clients carers/nurses can supply care to in healthcare.
attributes.background: In nurseries there is a ratio of 1 nursery nurse per 3 children depending on age. I want the same for the elderly. 1 carer for 4 clients needing care. 1 nurse for 5 clients. This obviously is just an estimate, it depends on other factors and should be looked into.

attributes.action: Publish the postal vote count separately at elections and referendums.
attributes.background: Given widespread concerns about the potential for electoral fraud being easier to perpetrate through postal voting than 'in-person' voting, we propose that postal votes be counted separately from the 'in-person' vote and the numbers for each count be published when the results are declared.
attributes.additional_details:
Electoral fraud is much easier to perpetrate through postal voting than voting in person as the opportunities for personation offences are multiplied significantly compared to where a person needs to present themselves at a polling station.

If there is significant variance between the two counts, any irregularities can be more easily highlighted and if necessary, investigated.

attributes.action: Force zoos to only hold animals that are incapable of surviving in the wild.
attributes.background: Animals should not be in captivity unless they are ill or can not survive in the wild. By replacing all of the well and healthy animals with sick or maltreated ones, we can provide a better quality of life for all animals. The healthy ones by releasing them back, and the sick by saving them.

attributes.action: Bring back maintenance grant for 2016?
attributes.background: After this rise of tution fees to 9000 students already going to be in a debt of 18000. If you scrap maintenance grant then thats double debt every year making the debt nearly 32000 this putting of students for going into higher education and those who do will be I debt for most of life.

attributes.action: Allow dividends paid to a Sipp in drawdown to be withdrawn tax free up to limit.
attributes.background: Dividends from shares are now tax free up to £5,000 pa. As a Sipp holder, soon to be in drawdown, I have realised that dividends paid to the Sipp, then withdrawn by the pension holder, will be taxed at marginal rate. Pensioners should have the option to withdraw dividends up to £5,000 pa tax free.

attributes.action: Amalgamate all examination boards in the UK into one Government regulated board
attributes.background:
-Inaccurate marking (many re-marks go up)
-Schools play game of "picking easiest board" to improve results
-Over-burdened markers leads to poor quality
-Ambiguity of papers/questions
-Difficulty/Simplicity of papers
attributes.additional_details:
The National Association for the Teaching of English (NATE) has identified significant issues with quality of A-level marking, including, "a crisis in confidence" with exam boards.

A new book by University of Cambridge professors has sharply criticized England’s exam boards system as being “bizarre” and “untenable”.

Mick Waters, former Director of Curriculum at the Qualifications and Curriculum Agency, who says that exam boards are “diseased” and “almost corrupt”.

attributes.action: Reduce Fees on Degrees that lead to Jobs in Public Services (Government Jobs)
attributes.background: Healthcare? Funded. Scientists? We cover them. Why is more not being done with the training for these roles? If a student agrees to terms where they're guaranteed a GVT job after completing their course, then fees for this student should either be scrapped entirely, or considerably discounted.
attributes.additional_details: How it would work: On beginning a degree such as medicine, physics, or one in teaching, you alert the government that upon the course's conclusion, you are happy to accept a predetermined government/public-services role (e.g. surgeon/MI5 agent/psychiatrist/physicist) with employment-terms as defined by the GVT. If you leave the course or job-role before a certain amount of time, then the fees will be charged like any other degree (as you won't have used it for the GVT's intended purpose).

attributes.action: Enforcement of election laws & removal of MPs found to be breaking the law
attributes.background:
MPs found guilty of breaking election rules (inc. how they declared costs) should be:
- expelled from the Commons & barred from by-election
also:
- elections should be nullified & a new by-election held
- others found implicated breaking election law should face full force of the law
attributes.additional_details:
Additionally, if there are several instances of MPs being disqualified, bills passed due the deciding votes of disqualified MPs should be brought before the House again after the by-elections have returned legitimately elected Members of Parliament. 
Current Investigations
http://www.markpack.org.uk/139895/conservative-mps-election-expenses-investigation-police/

attributes.action: Remove the NHS from goverment control and let it be independently run by experts
attributes.background: take the NHS out of direct government control and allow experts i.e doctors, nurses etc to have a say and run it properly without interference and micro management from Government health secretary Jeremy Hunt

attributes.action: 10k p.a higher earner's income transfer among couples with children
attributes.background: For married couple with children, Introduce a system where the higher earner can transfer up to £10k to low earning spouse to realize tax savings which can help with child care costs. E.g. If £50k earner in the 40% tax band could transfer £10k to spouse earning £15k to reduce tax on the transferred.

attributes.action: Increase SFE loan for volunteer placement year students in the UK
attributes.background: SFE is there to help students afford their university studies, however the amount offered for a volunteer (unpaid) placement year is considerably lower, making it hard for students to afford living costs. Universities are pushing for students to take placement years yet SFE is making it unaffordable
attributes.additional_details:
Universities and SFE offer varying amounts ranging from £2000 to £2500. According to the NUS average living costs for a student in the UK is £13,388 for living costs
(£6,143 for rent, £1,956 for food, £316 for household goods, £65 for insurance, £2,074 for personal items, £1,524 for travel and £1,310 for leisure).

attributes.action: Make schools more about learning and less about exams
attributes.background: Far too many children are not reaching their potential in schools because they're only rewarded using exams. This isn't the right method of assessment for everyone. Instead, coursework, participation marks and other such methods of assessment should be used to give a more rounded education.

attributes.action: Vendors withdrawing from sales should incur penalties to cover purchasers costs.
attributes.background:
Because of our Vendors decision to withdraw the sale of his property on the day of exchange, we have incurred searches costs,  legal and surveyors fees and now rental costs while we find another property.
We felt obliged to continue, our buyers are due to become parents.

attributes.action: Change the Childcare Act and enable childcare vouchers to be given for relatives
attributes.background: The Department For Education (DFE) allows some parents to claim free childcare for 2 years and for all 3 year olds. At the moment a relative of the child cannot claim this free childcare even if they are an approved childcare provider.
attributes.additional_details: According to the Childcare Act 2006 Childcare is deemed as care for a child that is not provided by a relative. There are many registered childminders who look after their relatives and therefore cannot claim the 15 hours free childcare. However if the child goes to a nursery where a relative works they are allowed to claim free childcare. If a childcare provider is registered and looking after a relative they should be entitled to claim for the free vouchers.

attributes.action: Adopt the 'Cornwall' model for all County Councils in England & Wales
attributes.background:
Cornwall, Co. Durham, Isle of Wight, Northumberland, Shropshire & Wiltshire are all Unitary Authorites with no District Councils.
The duties of former district councils is either devolved down to Town & Parish Councils, or where this is impractical (eg: roads) it is taken on at county level.
attributes.additional_details:
There are potential savings to be made in adopting the 'Cornwall' model, as there are many management positions duplicated across counties with District Councils, also some current local government buildings would be freed up for potential residential development.
Properly implememented it would also mean locally elected people would be responsible for what happens at a local level.
There are already some local authorities who are sharing services and this would be a progression of this.

attributes.action: UK public to be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.background: The UK public elect its most influential people, Prime Minister, Chancellor, Home Secretary, Lord Mayor etc as a democracy. The UK public should also be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.additional_details: The Governor of the Bank of England directly has control over the UK debt, availability of homes, interest rates. The governor also needs to have measurable objectives that his performance can be directly assessed.

attributes.action: Overseas Aid should be a voluntary opt in contribution collected via HMRC.
attributes.background: It is funded via my taxes and much of it is being fraudulently used by corrupt regimes such as those Mr Cameron named. The people of this country have the right to expect its elected representatives to spend taxes on their needs particularly on  defence of the realm.

attributes.action: Stop the NHS sharing patient records with third parties (e.g. Google).
attributes.background:
Patient records are confidential and should be available only to patients and healthcare professionals directly involved in their care.
Allowing access by third parties could, and almost certainly will, lead to improper use by insurance companies and marketing agencies.
attributes.additional_details: Sharing a patient's medical record with a third party should require specific authorisation by the patient.

attributes.action: Standardize the delay repay system formula across all train franchises.
attributes.background: Not all train companies pay out the same percentage compensation per journey for delayed/cancelled trains to season ticket holders. Southeastern divide the amount by 546 journeys a year yet Southern divide the cost by 464 journeys a year. All train companies should have to follow the same formula.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.southeasternrailway.co.uk/contact-us/delay-repay/more-information/ - Annual season ticket counts as 1/546.

http://www.southernrailway.com/your-journey/passengers-charter/ - On the passenger charter leaflet an annual season ticket counts as 1/464.

attributes.action: Confirm that there are no current or future plans to privatise the NHS
attributes.background: With the increasing persistent demand that Junior Doctors adopt a new contract that is not viable and will endanger patients health and the slow privatisation of some parts of the NHS. The government need to publically and on formal record confirm they have no intention to fully privatise the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: Some aspects of the ambulance service have been privatised as have some 'back office' functions. This latest contract being imposed on doctors is another way of taking control and imposing change on an already struggling NHS service. In order to show the governments committed to supporting and ensuring the continuation of the NHS they need to confirm what to date they have failed to do. That the NHS is a vital public service that WILL NOT ever be privatised but will instead be protected against it.

attributes.action: Remove Ntokozo Qwabe, the Oxford student.
attributes.background: Remove Ntokozo Qwabe, the Oxford student who was responsible for trying to remove Cecil Rhodes statue, from the UK. Remove his visa and return him for being a racist boasting about how he mistreated a white waitress and refused to tip because she was white.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.groundup.org.za/article/rhodes-must-fall-leader-waiter-we-will-give-tip-when-return-land/

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3566362/Oxford-student-Rhodes-Fall-campaign-boasts-refused-tip-waitress-white-left-floods-tears.html#comments

attributes.action: Allow everyone working (self employed or employed) to claim travel expenses.
attributes.background: Anyone employed and paying tax shoud be able to claim any expenses incurred against any tax payable including travel expenses.
attributes.additional_details: Self employed people and business owners are able to claim expenses against any tax they may owe. It is unfair that the lower paid can not claim travel expenses when travel to and from work can be a large expense for them.

attributes.action: Remove the indirect sex discrimination from the new junior doctors contract.
attributes.background: Deem the technically lawful but blatant sex discrimination in the equality impact assessment done on the new contract for junior doctors in England unworthy.  Require the government to address the adverse impact of the nodal pay model on those working part-time under the new contract.
attributes.additional_details:
see 
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/512696/jd-eia.pdf


"80. Insofar as the nodal pay model may disadvantage women working part-time (as compared with the hypothetical position under the existing contract) we consider 
25 that this is consistent with the principle of pay based on level of responsibility that 
underpins the new contract. Any indirect adverse effect which may occur is a proportionate means of achieving a legitimate aim." 

Note: The careful use of the term "indirect" to avoid falling foul of technical illegality, the wording falls foul of the spirit of the legislation but not the form.

attributes.action: Name under age murderers or serious offenders and sentence them as adults
attributes.background: Regardless of age, if you are capable of and willing to take or seriously damage/alter another's life, you should be considered old enough to be named, and charged as an adult. A child does not make these decisions, we have to stop protecting them and show them they can't just get away with it again

attributes.action: Stop Special Advisers for family members of Government Ministers and MP's
attributes.background: Special advisers should be be carefully scrutinised by the Parliamentary, expense standards  IPSA and should not be afforded to family members
attributes.additional_details: Recently the PM's wife was afforded the luxury of a fashion guru at the expense of the tax payer to the tune of £53,000

attributes.action: Make it law that you have to have a license to own an axe.
attributes.background: Today a police officer was attacked by someone with an axe.  Why are there not rules for people to own such an offensive weapon.  They are more deadly than firearms, they are silent and can be weilded indiscriminately.

attributes.action: Increase Maritime patrols / air surveillance at sea to protect the UK
attributes.background: Not enough patrol boats or air surveillance re intelligence and prevent terriosts traveling across the English Channel to gain entry into the UK.   Only five patrol boats currently. I reference 15/04/16 two Iranian men called 999 whilst floating in a small rubber boat in the sea

attributes.action: Reduce our foreign aid budget to that of the average of the 50 richest countries
attributes.background: We contribute more than any other nation other than the US. Who even they pay less than we pay taking in %GDP and per head of population.

attributes.action: make it illegal for fast food outlets to sell chicken on the bone
attributes.background: I live near several fast food outlets, people keep throwing their chicken bones on the street. I try my best but my dog keeps finding and eating them. He being sick and it had blood in and having a number 2 with blood in most recently. I'm worried this will end up killing him.

attributes.action: For the UK Government to gift Uganda a new Radiotherapy machine.
attributes.background: Uganda's only radiotherapy machine is broken beyond repair. Mulago Hospital, in the capital city of  Kampala, receives around 44,000 new referrals each year from neighbouring countries. Around 75% of these patients require this form of treatment. Their machine was second hand in the first instance.

attributes.action: The NHS to provide meals for staff, including staff at Queen's Medical Centre.
attributes.background: I want the NHS to provide meals for the staff at queens medical centre including agency staff that work at qmc. The staff work hard everyday and do not get a option whether they would like a meal, I'm writing this petition to ask you to get the nhs to provide meals for staff at the qmc.
attributes.additional_details: At the present moment if the staff at the queens medical centre eat the hospital food they get fired instantly, At fast food places such as McDonald's, burger king ect the staff get free meals, meanwhile the staff at queens medical centre save people lives everyday and they don't get the option. I would like the nhs to provide ethier free meals for the hospital staff or charge £1.00 per meal as they deserve it.

attributes.action: Support equal access to education for children in Africa.
attributes.background: Reports suggest that 70 million children get no education across the world and those living in north-eastern Africa are least likely to go to school. By raising awareness on the issue on a national scale we can help those children who are disadvantaged by supporting their journey through education.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theguardian.com/education/2010/sep/20/70m-get-no-education

An education would lead to a good career, build character and construct the foundations for a strong nation, which is further suggested by humanitarian Nelson Mandela; “Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.” If you teach a child how to read and write, it will allow them to be empowered with knowledge which will be crucial to give them a better future and the impacts to be sustained.

attributes.action: Stop armed forces recruiting in schools and lift joining age from 16 to 18.
attributes.background: Stop the armed forces from recruiting in schools and change the joining age from 16 to 18

attributes.action: Make Defibrillators a Legal Requirement in Schools and Public Places
attributes.background: Just like fire extinguishers, defibrillators are life saving pieces of equipment, and yet to most, are unheard-of. Whilst they are beginning to appear in more and more public places, there aren't nearly enough located in places where fire extinguishers, for example, are mandatory.
attributes.additional_details: Cardiac arrest can occur anywhere, at any given time. In such a circumstance, time is vital. Having life-saving equipment nearby will undoubtedly play a huge part in saving the patient's life should this occur.

attributes.action: Drug test all politicians.
attributes.background: Following the Psychoactive substances bill of 2015, we respectfully ask that all Members of the houses of parliament both elected and unelected practice what they preach. We therefore call for compulsory drug testing of all members, and their removal from office should they fail.

attributes.action: Bring more awareness and raise more money towards Dementia Researching
attributes.background: I believe that not enough people are aware of how badly Dementia is becoming. 1 in 3 people over 65 will die with dementia. 850, 000 were diagnosed with dementia in 2015. Researchers are still unaware of the proper causes and require more money to extend research and medical help, so help raise it.
attributes.additional_details: Visit: https://www.alzheimers.org.uk/statistics and https://www.alzheimers.org.uk/site/scripts/documents_info.php?documentID=535&pageNumber=2 for more information.
